channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Mattis tears into Trump in extraordinary rebuke
All four ex-officers now face charges in George Floyd's killing. Chauvin's charge is increased.
All former officers involved in George Floyd's death are now in custody
Trump tries to revise history about his church walk. Here's what really happened.
item.description: President Trump responds to law enforcement using smoke canisters and rubber bullets to break up a peaceful protest in front of the White House so he could visit a nearby church. CNN's Daniel Dale fact checks his claims.

item.title: 'Significant' new lead in Madeleine McCann's 2007 disappearance
item.description: British police officers investigating the disappearance of Madeleine McCann have identified a new suspect, 13 years after the three year-old vanished in Portugal.

item.title: US defense chief on shaky ground with White House after breaking with Trump over protest response
item.description: Secretary of Defense Mark Esper said Wednesday that he does not support using active duty troops to quell the large-scale protests across the United States triggered by the death of George Floyd and those forces should only be used in a law enforcement role as a last resort, comments that came after President Donald Trump recently threatened to deploy the military to enforce order.

item.title: George W. Bush finally steps onto the right side of history
item.description: May 25, 2020, will mark the day that systemic police reform became possible. And Tuesday afternoon marked the moment when we knew 2020 would be the year. That is the moment when a past president, who infamously was at the helm during a disaster that devastated black communities, stepped onto the right side of history. That is when I knew this time felt different.

item.title: Why Ben & Jerry's statement on white supremacy is so extraordinary
item.description: Let there be no doubt where Ben & Jerry's stands.

item.title: A heavily armed extremist movement is gaining traction in the US
item.description: Benjamin Ryan Teeter was at his home in Hampstead, N.C., when the call to action came. It was an alert from the heart of the raging protests in Minneapolis, posted on an online forum by a fellow member of the Boogaloo movement, a loosely knit group of heavily armed, anti-government extremists.

item.title: Joe Biden will almost certainly pick a black woman as VP
item.description: The biggest choice of Joe Biden's political life is being made for him -- by his own gaffes and the ongoing protests over the murder of George Floyd: It now seems a near-certainty that he will (and should) name a black woman as his vice presidential running mate.

item.title: Similarities between Floyd and Frenchman's deaths spark rage in Paris
item.description: In an echo of the Black Lives Matter protests in the US, protests in Paris were organized by Assa Traoré, whose brother Adama died while being detained by police in 2016. CNN's Melissa Bell reports.

item.title: US to block Chinese airlines from flying into the US
item.description: The US government says it will block Chinese airlines from flying into the US in response to what it says is a policy that has prevented US carriers from service between the two countries.

item.title: Philippines says it won't end US military access agreement amid South China Sea tensions
item.description: The Philippines has reversed its decision to end an important military agreement with the United States as territorial tensions with China heat up in the South China Sea.

item.title: Anti-Chinese sentiment rising in India
item.description: Google has removed an app that millions of Indians had downloaded hoping that it would help them boycott Chinese software.

item.title: Former first lady re-arrested for killing of husband's ex-wife
item.description: Former Lesotho first lady Maesaiah Thabane has been re-arrested for the killing of her husband's ex-wife, police said Wednesday.

item.title: Architect of Sweden's 'herd immunity' strategy defends decision but admits one big failure
WHO says coronavirus is not mutating, but that doesn't mean it is not dangerous
Fauci: US should have 'couple hundred million' doses of Covid-19 vaccine by start of 2021
item.description: The United States should have 100 million doses of one candidate coronavirus vaccine by the end of the year, Dr. Anthony Fauci, the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases and a member of the White House Coronavirus Task Force, said Tuesday.

item.title: Is it safe to go to a pool, the beach or a park? A doctor offers guidance
item.description: Even if we escaped getting sick from the coronavirus, we are all sick of staying at home, practicing social distancing and wearing masks. While case numbers and deaths from Covid-19 are trending downward, this is not the time to let down your guard. These are not ordinary days. These novel days call on us to make decisions with limited and evolving information. The coronavirus is still circulating.

item.title: Late-night hosts mock Trump's bible moment
item.description: Late Night hosts Stephen Colbert, Jimmy Fallon, and Seth Meyers had fun with President Trump's impromptu photo event in front of the St. John's Episcopal Church in Washington.

item.title: LeBron James rips Drew Brees over comments on kneeling protests
item.description: Drew Brees, the popular New Orleans Saints quarterback, caught heat Wednesday after saying he will "never agree with anybody disrespecting the flag of the United States of America or our country."

item.title: Apple is tracking iPhones stolen by looters
item.description: Apple is sending a clear message to people who've stolen iPhones from its stores: You're "being tracked."

item.title: America is in turmoil and stocks are booming. Is the market broken?
Snapchat to stop promoting Trump after controversial posts
item.description: Snapchat will no longer promote President Donald Trump's account on its platfrom in the wake of his controversial comments on ongoing protests across the US, the company announced Wednesday.

item.title: Video shows Australian police trip and throw down teen
item.description: Footage circulated on social media and verified by Australian police shows an officer violently arrest a 17-year-old Indigenous boy. The officer has been placed on restricted duties while authorities review the incident.

item.title: Eight-year-old girl tortured to death for releasing pet parrots, police say
item.description: An 8-year-old girl illegally employed as a maid has been killed by her employers in Rawalpindi, Pakistan for letting their pet parrots escape, police say.

item.title: Skateboarding prodigy's father speaks of terror not knowing if daughter would 'make it through the night' after horror fall
item.description: It's the kind of terror only a parent could know.

item.title: Laser mapping reveals largest and oldest Mayan temple
item.description: For decades, archeologists have keep their eyes down to the ground as they slashed through jungles, attempting to spot traces left by lost civilizations like the Khmer Empire in Cambodia and the Maya in Mexico and Central America.

item.title: World's biggest movie theater chain has 'substantial doubt' it can stay in business
item.description: AMC Theatres, the world's biggest movie theater chain, said on Wednesday that it has "substantial doubt" it can remain in business after closing locations across the globe during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Student gets emotional describing violent arrest
item.description: Students Messiah Young and Taniyah Pilgrim describe their arrests which resulted in six Atlanta Police officers being charged with use of excessive force.

item.title: 'Star Wars' actor at London protest: I don't know if I'll have a career after this
item.description: "Star Wars" actor John Boyega rallied crowds at a large London protest against George Floyd's death on Wednesday, telling demonstrators that "now is the time" to demand racial equality.

item.title: Fauci shares optimistic hope on Covid-19 vaccines
item.description: The US should have 100 million doses of one candidate Covid-19 vaccine by the end of the year, Dr. Anthony Fauci, the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) and a member of the White House coronavirus task force, said Tuesday.

item.title: NBA expected to approve plan to continue season with only 22 teams
item.description: The NBA's return is imminent -- but it could only be with 22 teams.

item.title: 'I don't see racism at all in the NFL,' Denver Broncos head coach says
item.description: Denver Broncos head coach Vic Fangio told reporters Tuesday he doesn't believe racism and discrimination are issues in the NFL.

item.title: Flight attendant stunned by passenger's identity after emotional talk
item.description: A Southwest Airlines flight attendant had an emotional conversation about race with a passenger who later revealed he was the CEO of American Airlines.

item.title: We went backpacking with suitcases in Italy and it was a mess
item.description: Like many people, I developed an obsession with Italy relatively early in life. Unlike many people, mine was probably inspired by a cartoon dream sequence in which Yogi Bear and his girlfriend Cindy sailed through Venice on a gondola.

item.title: Austrian architects will transform Hitler's birthplace into a police station
item.description: Austria has unveiled plans to transform Adolf Hitler's birthplace into a police station, following years of debate and legal wrangling over the controversial site.

item.title: Some people don't want black players to succeed, up-and-coming US tennis star says
item.description: He's one of his country's brightest prospects on the tennis tour, but US star Frances Tiafoe says a lack of diversity in the sport makes him feels like an "outsider."

item.title: Mars' moons may hint that the planet once had rings
item.description: Mars has two small, funky-looking moons with strange orbits, and they may suggest that the red planet once had rings, like some of the larger planets in our solar system.

item.title: The Italian artist imagining eerie futuristic cities
item.description: In Italian artist Giacomo Costa's imagined urban landscapes, shadowy concrete apartment buildings are stacked high, devoid of human presence. In other images he depicts sculptural feats of architecture, their damaged facades eclipsing towering skylines. More of his scenes reveal the husks of buildings overgrown with dense, green plants as woods overtake the remains of empty cities.

item.title: When we go back to eating out, more of us will pay with our phones
item.description: Major restaurant chains are trying to make it easier for customers to get their food without touching anything but their own phones.

item.title: Why one man owns 2,371 cell phones
item.description: Jayesh Kale is a collector in India who has spent at least five years gathering cell phones, calling the devices in the collection his "babies."

item.title: Healthy people shouldn't take daily aspirin to prevent heart disease, review finds
Ex-defense chief says of Trump: 'We are witnessing the consequences of three years without mature leadership'
item.description: • Trump launches defensive Twitter spree as America grieves • Analysis: Trump's 'bunker' story tells you everything you need to know about him • Trump tries to revise history about church walk. Here's what really happened

item.title: Obama: This country was founded on protest
Trump's 'bunker' story tells you everything you need to know about him
item.description: In an interview with Fox News Radio on Wednesday morning, President Donald Trump said something that is laughably untrue.

item.title: All four ex-officers charged in George Floyd's killing
item.description: • LIVE UPDATES: All officers now in custody • Protesters joyous after charges unveiled • Democratic congressman caught on hot mic: 'If I didn't have a primary, I wouldn't care'

item.title: Beijing outraged by Boris Johnson's move on Hong Kong
item.description: • US to block Chinese airlines from flying to America

item.title: Covid-19 cases in Europe continue to decline
Rand Paul holds up anti-lynching legislation
item.description: Republican Sen. Rand Paul of Kentucky said Wednesday he is holding up popular bipartisan legislation to make lynching a federal crime, a long-sought goal of supporters that is acutely relevant now against the backdrop of nationwide protests against police mistreatment of African Americans.
